label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of the seated Pope in three-quarter view to right. Enframed in a circular frame, below coat-of-arms of the Pope. A fragment of a series.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. The emperor wears a laurel wreath, armor, and a drapery around his shoulders. The portrait in a wreath frame; above, an eagle with sceptre; below, two putto holding the label of the portrait.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Half-length portrait of a middle-aged man wearing a wig and an official robe. In an oval frame with inscription. Below, coat-of-arms and a pedestal.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait of an elderly man slightly turned to right. He wears a four-cornered hat and an overcoat which leaves visible the collars of his shirt and jacket.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait in three-quarter view to left. Maximilian wears a white brimmed hat and the order of Toison d'or around his shoulders and over his coat. Portrait in an oval frame standing on an inscribed pedestal.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Children at play. Two little girls and a boy pursue a butterfly that has landed on a hollhawk bloom near a large sculpted urn.

value: Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt; 1931: acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. The smiling architect wears a round hat and a coat with a big square collar. He holds in his right hand dividers; in his left, a sphere.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait in frontal view. Luther is wearing a hat and a coat with a fur collar. The portrait is in an oval frame composed of palm leaves and tied with ribbons. It stands on a small inscribed pedestal.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. The Father, a middle-aged man, wears a skull cap and a cape with a hood. Portrait is in an oval frame; below, coat-of-arms with insciption.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of an elderly man in three-quarter view to left. He is wearing a closed vest, showing shirt collar and sleeves; his head is bare. The oval frame is richly ornamented and is set into an octagonal frame decorated with oak leaves. On both sides, two female grotesques holding a flaming case.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Half-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. The sitter wears a "kepi" and armor. In the four corners of the oval frame are four figures, the upper ones are seated old men; the lower ones, kneeling satyrs. On reverse, life history of Giulio Orsini.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Bust-length portrait in frontal view of an elderly man wearing a small hat, ruffled collar and a tightly fitted jacket of a patterned textile.

value: Bust-length portrait of a young man in three-quarter view to right. The young man is smiling. He wears a white vest and dark jacket with his hair cut short.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of a middle-aged man in three-quarter view facing right. He is wearing a wig. The portrait is encircled by an oval frame and wreath.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

value: Bust-length portrait of an old bearded men in three-quarter view facing left, in a medallion which is set into an elaborate framework of flanking pillars joined by an entablature upon which a muse is painting the portrait of Stefano. Two putto seated on brackets at the base of the pillars.

The Genius of Modesty Preventing Love Unveiling Beauty

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In the center, around a goat, are grouped satyrs, bacchantes and cupids. A cupid feeding the goat. Next to him kneeling woman embraced by a satyr. Mountains in background.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: In the center, a child riding on a kneeling satyr. Another child kicks the satyr. At right, a bacchante dances in front of a herm. Several other figures around. At left, trees; in background a mountain.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait. The body in side view facing right, the head turned to front. Lebrun wearing a wig and dressed in a loose robe, which leaves the lace collar of his shirt visible. In an oval frame with the coat-of-arms below. It stands on a moulding.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait in three-quarter view to right. The sitter is wearing a huge wig and loose robe. In an oval frame standing on a pedestal. The lower part of the frame has a label attached with inscription.

label: Provenance
value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Eleanor and Sarah Hewitt

label: Description
value: A bust-length portrait of a middle-aged cardinal in three-quarter view to right. In an oval frame held by two small angels. Part of an entablature decoration composed of stele crest, eff-and-dart and wreath motifs on mouldings.

value: Eleanor Garnier Hewitt and Sarah Cooper Hewitt; 1931; Acquired by Museum

Portrait of Charles II of Spain (1661-1700)

value: Charles II as a young boy of about six years of age at the time he was proclaimed king. The handsome boy with long blond hair is depicted in three-quarter view to left. He wears the royal robe with the order of Toison d'or; his name inscribed on the frame, below.

label: Description
value: Bust-length portrait of the Duchess, head turned slightly to left, body to right. She wears large earrings and matching jewels in her hair. Around her shoulders is an ermine stole. The oval frame is supported by an inscribed pedestal.

value: View looking North on Broadway from Wall Street, with cut-out section showing proposed railway under the street, approached by stairways either side.
